article: I was taken out of high school by my mother. I knew that my _ would become difficult because we were taught that we had to have an education to make it in life. Since I was only 16, I really started feeling hopeless in life _ I didn't know what I was going to do. I worked to help my _ pay bills and that was all I could do at the time. Then she started telling me that when I turned 18 I had to get out of the house.  I couldn't understand what was going on because my brother was _ than me and she didn't want to _ him out. As my 18th birthday was coming I was really beginning to feel _ because I didn't have an idea on what to do. One night while I was _ television, an advertisement came on about joining the Navy. The next day I called the _ on the advertisement and set up an appointment to meet the recruiter . When he _ about me not having a high school diploma he knew I had a _ chance. I explained to him that I was going to be homeless in a few _ . He told me he would _ what he could do. About two months later he called me and _ me to come to his office. I went in and he _ to me he would have to pull some strings to get me in the service _ I had to promise him that I would make the best of this opportunity he was trying to _ for me and I did.  Now I have a high _ in life that many people don't have and an ability to make my life a little _ with that decision I made and the help I received.
